frame.name: Awareness_status
frame.definition:
<def-root>Some <fen>Content</fen> is part of the mental model of a <fen>Cognizer</fen>. The <fen>Cognizer</fen> arrives at the mental model not by direct perception but by reasoning from perceived phenomena. Alternatively, the <fen>Role</fen> of a particular object is known to be applicable to that object.
<ex><fex name="con">That fact</fex> is <t>known</t> <fex name="cog">to many</fex>.</ex>
<ex>The <t>presumed</t> <fex name="rol">killer</fex> was last seen driving south on the interstate.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who has (or lacks) awareness of the <fen>Content</fen>.
<ex>That this chemical is dangerous to consume has been <t>known</t> <fex name="cog">to us</fex> for a long time now.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition:
<def-root>The fact or idea which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is aware of.
<ex><fex name="con">That most of them are dangerous</fex> is not yet <t>known</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the state of awareness holds.
<ex>That is <fex name="deg">well</fex> <t>known</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition:
<def-root>The category whose applicability to the <fen>Content</fen> is known.
<ex>The patient arrived with a <t>suspected</t> <fex name="rol">broken leg</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has awareness (or lack thereof) of the <fen>Content</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="tim">long</fex> <t>suspected</t> killer has now released a statement outlining his thoughts on the criminal case.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: suspected.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: believed to be possibly true.

lexUnit.name: presumed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: assumed to be true absent evidence to the contrary.
